content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Factory burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT, which is interconnected with a burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) and an assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Belt Depot at position (3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden chest serving as depot placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Transport belt segment placed adjacent at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
– Depot burner inserter located at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP

### Extraction System at position (–3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction system burner inserter located at Position(x=–3.5, y=27.5) with its drop position at Position(x=–3.5, y=28.5)

ERROR TIPS

• Connection Target Error – Transport Belt
 – When connecting transport belts, ensure the target entity is an inserter rather than a steam engine. The repeated failure to connect arises from attempting to attach belts directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object.

• Placement Range and Inventory Checks
 – When placing entities such as wooden chests, verify that the target position is within the allowed placement distance by moving closer to the position.
 – Confirm that the required item is present in the inventory before attempting placement.

• Variable Definition Consistency
 – Ensure that all referenced variables (for example, using the correct name for the target chest) are properly defined to avoid runtime NameErrors.
